items.name: FGPFCCR
items.description: DMA2D foreground PFC (pixel format converter) control register

items.name: BGPFCCR
items.description: DMA2D background PFC (pixel format converter) control register

items.name: FGCMAR
items.description: DMA2D foreground CLUT memory address register

items.name: BGCMAR
items.description: DMA2D background CLUT memory address register

items.name: OPFCCR
items.description: DMA2D output PFC (pixel format converter) control register

items.name: AMTCR
items.description: DMA2D AXI master timer configuration register

fieldset/AMTCR.description: DMA2D AXI master timer configuration register

fields.name: EN
fields.description: Enable. Enables the dead time functionality.

fields.name: DT
fields.description: Dead time. Dead time value in the AXI clock cycle inserted between two consecutive accesses on the AXI master port. These bits represent the minimum guaranteed number of cycles between two consecutive AXI accesses.

fieldset/BGCMAR.description: DMA2D background CLUT memory address register

fields.name: MA
fields.description: Memory address. Address of the data used for the CLUT address dedicated to the background image. This register can only be written when no transfer is on going. Once the CLUT transfer has started, this register is read-only. If the background CLUT format is 32-bit, the address must be 32-bit aligned.

fields.name: BLUE
fields.description: Blue value. These bits define the blue value for the A4 or A8 mode of the background. These bits can only be written when data transfers are disabled. Once the transfer has started, they are read-only.

fields.name: GREEN
fields.description: Green value. These bits define the green value for the A4 or A8 mode of the background. These bits can only be written when data transfers are disabled. Once the transfer has started, they are read-only.

fields.name: RED
fields.description: Red value. These bits define the red value for the A4 or A8 mode of the background. These bits can only be written when data transfers are disabled. Once the transfer has started, they are read-only.

fields.name: MA
fields.description: Memory address. Address of the data used for the background image. This register can only be written when data transfers are disabled. Once a data transfer has started, this register is read-only. The address alignment must match the image format selected e.g. a 32-bit per pixel format must be 32-bit aligned, a 16-bit per pixel format must be 16-bit aligned and a 4-bit per pixel format must be 8-bit aligned.

fields.name: LO
fields.description: Line offset used for the background image (expressed in pixels (default) or bytes as per LOM in CR). This value is used for the address generation. It is added at the end of each line to determine the starting address of the next line. These bits can only be written when data transfers are disabled. Once data transfer has started, they become read-only. If the image format is 4-bit per pixel, the line offset must be even.

fieldset/BGPFCCR.description: DMA2D background PFC (pixel format converter) control register

fields.name: CM
fields.description: Color mode. These bits define the color format of the foreground image. These bits can only be written when data transfers are disabled. Once the transfer has started, they are read-only. others: meaningless

fields.name: CCM
fields.description: CLUT (color lookup table) color mode. These bits define the color format of the CLUT. This register can only be written when the transfer is disabled. Once the CLUT transfer has started, this bit is read-only.

fields.name: START
fields.description: Start. This bit is set to start the automatic loading of the CLUT. This bit is automatically reset: ** at the end of the transfer ** when the transfer is aborted by the user application by setting the ABORT bit in the DMA2D_CR ** when a transfer error occurs ** when the transfer has not started due to a configuration error or another transfer operation already on going (data transfer or automatic BackGround CLUT transfer).

fields.name: CS
fields.description: CLUT size. These bits define the size of the CLUT used for the BG. Once the CLUT transfer has started, this field is read-only. The number of CLUT entries is equal to CS[7:0] + 1.

fields.name: AM
fields.description: Alpha mode. These bits define which alpha channel value to be used for the background image. These bits can only be written when data transfers are disabled. Once the transfer has started, they are read-only. others: meaningless

fields.name: AI
fields.description: Alpha inverted. This bit inverts the alpha value. Once the transfer has started, this bit is read-only.

fields.name: RBS
fields.description: Red blue swap. This bit allows to swap the R and B to support BGR or ABGR color formats. Once the transfer has started, this bit is read-only.

fields.name: ALPHA
fields.description: Alpha value. These bits define a fixed alpha channel value which can replace the original alpha value or be multiplied with the original alpha value according to the alpha mode selected with bits AM[1: 0]. These bits can only be written when data transfers are disabled. Once the transfer has started, they are read-only.

fields.name: START
fields.description: Start. This bit can be used to launch the DMA2D according to the parameters loaded in the various configuration registers

fields.name: SUSP
fields.description: Suspend. This bit can be used to suspend the current transfer. This bit is set and reset by software. It is automatically reset by hardware when the START bit is reset.

fields.name: ABORT
fields.description: Abort. This bit can be used to abort the current transfer. This bit is set by software and is automatically reset by hardware when the START bit is reset.

fields.name: LOM
fields.description: Line offset mode. This bit configures how the line offset is expressed (in pixels or bytes) for the foreground, background and output. This bit is set and cleared by software. It can not be modified while a transfer is ongoing.

fields.name: TEIE
fields.description: Transfer error interrupt enable. This bit is set and cleared by software.

fields.name: TCIE
fields.description: Transfer complete interrupt enable. This bit is set and cleared by software.

fields.name: TWIE
fields.description: Transfer watermark interrupt enable. This bit is set and cleared by software.

fields.name: CAEIE
fields.description: CLUT access error interrupt enable. This bit is set and cleared by software.

fields.name: CTCIE
fields.description: CLUT transfer complete interrupt enable. This bit is set and cleared by software.

fields.name: CEIE
fields.description: Configuration error interrupt enable. This bit is set and cleared by software.

fields.name: MODE
fields.description: DMA2D mode This bit is set and cleared by software. It cannot be modified while a transfer is ongoing.

fieldset/FGCMAR.description: DMA2D foreground CLUT memory address register

fields.name: MA
fields.description: Memory Address. Address of the data used for the CLUT address dedicated to the foreground image. This register can only be written when no transfer is ongoing. Once the CLUT transfer has started, this register is read-only. If the foreground CLUT format is 32-bit, the address must be 32-bit aligned.

fields.name: BLUE
fields.description: Blue Value. These bits define the blue value for the A4 or A8 mode of the foreground image. They can only be written when data transfers are disabled. Once the transfer has started, They are read-only.

fields.name: GREEN
fields.description: Green Value. These bits define the green value for the A4 or A8 mode of the foreground image. They can only be written when data transfers are disabled. Once the transfer has started, They are read-only.

fields.name: RED
fields.description: Red Value. These bits define the red value for the A4 or A8 mode of the foreground image. They can only be written when data transfers are disabled. Once the transfer has started, they are read-only.

fields.name: MA
fields.description: Memory address. Address of the data used for the foreground image. This register can only be written when data transfers are disabled. Once the data transfer has started, this register is read-only. The address alignment must match the image format selected e.g. a 32-bit per pixel format must be 32-bit aligned, a 16-bit per pixel format must be 16-bit aligned and a 4-bit per pixel format must be 8-bit aligned.

fields.name: LO
fields.description: Line offset. Line offset used for the foreground expressed in pixel. This value is used to generate the address. It is added at the end of each line to determine the starting address of the next line. These bits can only be written when data transfers are disabled. Once a data transfer has started, they become read-only. If the image format is 4-bit per pixel, the line offset must be even.

fieldset/FGPFCCR.description: DMA2D foreground PFC (pixel format converter) control register

fields.name: CM
fields.description: Color mode. These bits define the color format of the foreground image. They can only be written when data transfers are disabled. Once the transfer has started, they are read-only. others: meaningless

fields.name: CCM
fields.description: CLUT color mode. This bit defines the color format of the CLUT. It can only be written when the transfer is disabled. Once the CLUT transfer has started, this bit is read-only.

fields.name: START
fields.description: Start. This bit can be set to start the automatic loading of the CLUT. It is automatically reset: ** at the end of the transfer ** when the transfer is aborted by the user application by setting the ABORT bit in DMA2D_CR ** when a transfer error occurs ** when the transfer has not started due to a configuration error or another transfer operation already ongoing (data transfer or automatic background CLUT transfer).

fields.name: CS
fields.description: CLUT size. These bits define the size of the CLUT used for the foreground image. Once the CLUT transfer has started, this field is read-only. The number of CLUT entries is equal to CS[7:0] + 1.

fields.name: AM
fields.description: Alpha mode. These bits select the alpha channel value to be used for the foreground image. They can only be written data the transfer are disabled. Once the transfer has started, they become read-only. other configurations are meaningless

fields.name: CSS
fields.description: Chroma Sub-Sampling. These bits define the chroma sub-sampling mode for YCbCr color mode. Once the transfer has started, these bits are read-only. others: meaningless

fields.name: AI
fields.description: Alpha inverted. This bit inverts the alpha value. Once the transfer has started, this bit is read-only.

fields.name: RBS
fields.description: Red blue swap. This bit allows to swap the R and B to support BGR or ABGR color formats. Once the transfer has started, this bit is read-only.

fields.name: ALPHA
fields.description: Alpha value. These bits define a fixed alpha channel value which can replace the original alpha value or be multiplied by the original alpha value according to the alpha mode selected through the AM[1:0] bits. These bits can only be written when data transfers are disabled. Once a transfer has started, they become read-only.

fields.name: CTEIF
fields.description: Clear transfer error interrupt flag. Programming this bit to 1 clears the TEIF flag in the DMA2D_ISR register

fields.name: CTCIF
fields.description: Clear transfer complete interrupt flag. Programming this bit to 1 clears the TCIF flag in the DMA2D_ISR register

fields.name: CTWIF
fields.description: Clear transfer watermark interrupt flag. Programming this bit to 1 clears the TWIF flag in the DMA2D_ISR register

fields.name: CAECIF
fields.description: Clear CLUT access error interrupt flag. Programming this bit to 1 clears the CAEIF flag in the DMA2D_ISR register

fields.name: CCTCIF
fields.description: Clear CLUT transfer complete interrupt flag. Programming this bit to 1 clears the CTCIF flag in the DMA2D_ISR register

fields.name: CCEIF
fields.description: Clear configuration error interrupt flag. Programming this bit to 1 clears the CEIF flag in the DMA2D_ISR register

fields.name: TEIF
fields.description: Transfer error interrupt flag. This bit is set when an error occurs during a DMA transfer (data transfer or automatic CLUT loading).

fields.name: TCIF
fields.description: Transfer complete interrupt flag. This bit is set when a DMA2D transfer operation is complete (data transfer only).

fields.name: TWIF
fields.description: Transfer watermark interrupt flag. This bit is set when the last pixel of the watermarked line has been transferred.

fields.name: CAEIF
fields.description: CLUT access error interrupt flag. This bit is set when the CPU accesses the CLUT while the CLUT is being automatically copied from a system memory to the internal DMA2D.

fields.name: CTCIF
fields.description: CLUT transfer complete interrupt flag. This bit is set when the CLUT copy from a system memory area to the internal DMA2D memory is complete.

fields.name: CEIF
fields.description: Configuration error interrupt flag. This bit is set when the START bit of DMA2D_CR, DMA2DFGPFCCR or DMA2D_BGPFCCR is set and a wrong configuration has been programmed.

fields.name: LW
fields.description: Line watermark. These bits allow to configure the line watermark for interrupt generation. An interrupt is raised when the last pixel of the watermarked line has been transferred. These bits can only be written when data transfers are disabled. Once the transfer has started, they are read-only.

fields.name: NL
fields.description: Number of lines. Number of lines of the area to be transferred. These bits can only be written when data transfers are disabled. Once the transfer has started, they are read-only.

fields.name: PL
fields.description: Pixel per lines. Number of pixels per lines of the area to be transferred. These bits can only be written when data transfers are disabled. Once the transfer has started, they are read-only. If any of the input image format is 4-bit per pixel, pixel per lines must be even.

fields.name: COLOR
fields.description: Color. Color in the format specified by color mode in OPFCCR (16, 24 or 32 bits). These bits can only be written when data transfers are disabled. Once the transfer has started, they are read-only.

fields.name: MA
fields.description: Memory Address. Address of the data used for the output FIFO. These bits can only be written when data transfers are disabled. Once the transfer has started, they are read-only. The address alignment must match the image format selected e.g. a 32-bit per pixel format must be 32-bit aligned and a 16-bit per pixel format must be 16-bit aligned.

fields.name: LO
fields.description: Line offset. Line offset used for the output (expressed in pixels). This value is used for the address generation. It is added at the end of each line to determine the starting address of the next line. These bits can only be written when data transfers are disabled. Once the transfer has started, they are read-only.

fields.name: CM
fields.description: Color mode. These bits define the color format of the output image. These bits can only be written when data transfers are disabled. Once the transfer has started, they are read-only. others: meaningless

fields.name: SB
fields.description: Swap Bytes

fields.name: AI
fields.description: Alpha inverted. This bit inverts the alpha value. Once the transfer has started, this bit is read-only.

fields.name: RBS
fields.description: Red blue swap. This bit allows to swap the R and B to support BGR or ABGR color formats. Once the transfer has started, this bit is read-only.

variants.name: Regular
variants.description: No red blue swap (RGB or ARGB)

variants.name: Start
variants.description: Start the automatic loading of the CLUT

variants.name: Clear
variants.description: Clear the CAEIF flag in the ISR register

variants.name: Clear
variants.description: Clear the CEIF flag in the ISR register

variants.name: Clear
variants.description: Clear the CTCIF flag in the ISR register

variants.name: Clear
variants.description: Clear the TCIF flag in the ISR register

variants.name: Clear
variants.description: Clear the TEIF flag in the ISR register

variants.name: Clear
variants.description: Clear the TWIF flag in the ISR register

variants.name: Regular
variants.description: No red blue swap (RGB or ARGB)

variants.name: Start
variants.description: Start the automatic loading of the CLUT

variants.name: MemoryToMemoryPFC
variants.description: Memory-to-memory with PFC (pixel format converter) (FG fetch only with FG PFC active)

variants.name: MemoryToMemoryPFCBlending
variants.description: Memory-to-memory with blending (FG and BG fetch with PFC and blending)

variants.name: RegisterToMemory
variants.description: Register-to-memory (no FG nor BG, only output stage active)

variants.name: MemoryToMemoryPFCBlendingFixedColorFG
variants.description: Memory-to-memory with blending and fixed color FG (BG fetch only with FG and BG PFC active)

variants.name: MemoryToMemoryPFCBlendingFixedColorBG
variants.description: Memory-to-memory with blending and fixed color BG (FG fetch only with FG and BG PFC active)

variants.name: Regular
variants.description: No red blue swap (RGB or ARGB)

variants.name: SwapBytes
variants.description: Bytes are swapped two by two
